words.definition: An aroma is a scent or smell.
words.example: I love the aroma of coffee in the morning.

words.definition: A beverage is a drink.
words.example: The waiter brought our beverages first. Then he brought our food.

words.definition: A cluster of things is a small group of them placed close together.
words.example: She held a large cluster of grapes in her hand.

words.definition: To combine is to join together to make a single thing or group.
words.example: Mina combined peanut butter and jelly to make a sandwich.

words.definition: When a liquid is condensed, it is made thicker.
words.example: One way to make a dessert thick and sweet is to use condensed milk.

words.definition: When something is contemporary, it is related to the present time.
words.example: Contemporary scientists have learned quite a bit about DNA.

words.definition: To cultivate plants is to care for them and help them grow.
words.example: A research company is cultivating new kinds of rice to aid poor countries.

words.definition: When something is divine, it is related to gods.
words.example: Legends say that music was given to men as a divine gift from the gods.

words.definition: When it is humid, there is a lot of water in the air.
words.example: It is very humid inside of a sauna.

words.definition: An odor is a very distinct smell.
words.example: He knew there was a leak when he noticed the strong odor of natural gas.

words.definition: The palate is the top part of the mouth.
words.example: You can touch your palate with your tongue.

words.definition: Paradise is the place or condition of happiness where things are perfect.
words.example: My vacation in Hawaii was like being in paradise.

words.definition: A plantation is a big farm that only grows certain kinds of crops.
words.example: In the 1800s, there were many cotton plantations in the southern US.

words.definition: When something is rapid, it moves or changes very quickly.
words.example: His mother was surprised by her sonâ€™s rapid growth.

words.definition: A rate is the speed at which something happens.
words.example: Grass tends to grow at a very slow rate.

words.definition: When something is soothing, it makes you calm or relaxed.
words.example: The soothing music helped the baby fall asleep.

words.definition: When something is subtle, it is not easy to see or notice.
words.example: The handsome man has a subtle smile.

words.definition: The texture of something is the way its surface looks and feels.
words.example: The texture of a rock found in the water is typically very smooth.

words.definition: When something is toxic, it is poisonous. Toxic things are very dangerous.
words.example: Please check the label to see if the product is toxic.

words.definition: To vary means to be different from another thing in size or amount.
words.example: The heights of the people in my class vary by a large amount.
